remarks: Elements of the free module are mappings with two arguments defined by their operation values.  (Contributed by AV, 20-Feb-2019.)
statement:
mpt2frlmd.f $e |- F = ( R freeLMod ( N X. M ) ) $.
mpt2frlmd.v $e |- V = ( Base ` F ) $.
mpt2frlmd.s $e |- ( ( i = a /\ j = b ) -> A = B ) $.
mpt2frlmd.a $e |- ( ( ph /\ i e. N /\ j e. M ) -> A e. X ) $.
mpt2frlmd.b $e |- ( ( ph /\ a e. N /\ b e. M ) -> B e. Y ) $.
mpt2frlmd.e $e |- ( ph -> ( N e. U /\ M e. W /\ Z e. V ) ) $.
mpt2frlmd $p |- ( ph -> ( Z = ( a e. N , b e. M |-> B ) <-> A. i e. N A. j e. M ( i Z j ) = A ) ) $.
$d A a b $.
$d B i j $.
$d M a b i j $.
$d N a b i j $.
$d R a b i j $.
$d U a b i j $.
$d V a b i j $.
$d W a b i j $.
$d X a b i j $.
$d Y a b i j $.
$d Z a b i j $.
$d a b i j ph $.
